nameEntry.part: Find & Connect Support Service Western Australia

biogHist.abstract: The Find & Connect Support Service Western Australia ('Lanterns House') was established in February, 2013. It is part of the national network of Find & Connect Support Services, funded by the Australian government following the Apology to Forgotten Australians and Former Child Migrants in 2009. Find & Connect Lanterns provides services to Australian-born Forgotten Children and Former Child Migrants who spent time in foster homes, orphanages, children's homes or other 'care' institutions in Western Australia during the twentieth century.
biogHist.p: Lanterns House is specifically equipped to provide support and assistance to people who want to

list.item: obtain records of their time in 'care'
access individual counselling and group support
participate in social activities or simply drop in for a cuppa and a chat
connect with other service and support organisations that may be able to help them at this time in their lives.

descriptiveNote.p: Find & Connect Support Service can assist people who were in out-of-home care as children to apply for records of adoption.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Child and Youth Migration to Western Australia (1913 - 1968)

descriptiveNote.p: Find & Connect Support Service provides support and assistance for people who came from the United Kingdom and Malta to children's homes in Western Australia.
Find & Connect Support Service provides support and assistance for Australian-born people who were in out-of-home care as children in Western Australia.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Find & Connect Support Service Western Australia', in Find & Connect - Western Australia,

bibref.title: Find & Connect Support Service Western Australia

archref.abstract: This is an image of the building where Lanterns House, the Find & Connect Support Service for Western Australia, has been located since March 2014.
